abstract: The plan to repay $45 billion in federal aid should help the bank recruit a new chief executive by freeing it from Treasury restrictions on executive pay.
snippet: The plan to repay $45 billion in federal aid should help the bank recruit a new chief executive by freeing it from Treasury restrictions on executive pay.
lead_paragraph: Less than a year after grasping two multibillion-dollar bailouts from Washington, a resurgent Bank of America announced on Wednesday that it would repay all of its federal aid, underscoring the banking industry’s swift recovery from the gravest financial crisis since the Depression.

headline.main: Move to Repay Aid Helps Bank of America Shed Stigma
headline.print_headline: BANK OF AMERICA READY TO REFUND FEDERAL BAILOUT

headline.main: Bank of America’s TARP Move Helps Shed Stigma
